text: From bottle shared at Ratebeer Best awards and bottle-share. Hazy golden muddy orange color with off white head. Malty, hoppy and yeasty aroma, tart fruity, stone fruits, tropical fruits, passion fruit. Sweet and moderate to heavy acidic taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
[1/29/17] Bottle/Can/Crowler/Growler at the RateBeer award ceremony bottle share at Flamingo Hotel in Santa Rosa. Lactic, funky, oak, lots of passion fruit and pomegranate, acidic.

May 2016 - Bottle share at The Canary Wharf Reflux Party, with many thanks to Bruce.  As De Garde Passion Pom Bu, 4.8%.  Matte orange, opaque, small foamy off-white head.  Aroma is grapefruit, deep orange, some pineapple, stone fruit.  Body is smooth with tingly carbonation.  Taste is pineapple, passionfruit, orange pith, light acidity.  Very fruity with nice balance.  Potent at a low ABV. Very good. (3.9)

Bottle shared at a level 42 tasting Canary wharf 5/5/2016. Many thanks to Bruce for this one. Translucent golden orange coloured pour with a a off white thin white head. Aroma is sour apricot, tangy orange, mango pez sweets, passion fruit. Five alive on the nose. Flavour is composed of passion fruit, sour, apricot mango, fruit fruit, slightly tart acid, . , Palate is dry sour, acidic, highish carbonation. Very good. Love the passion fruit.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with white head. Passion fruit, some tart pomegranate, sour and fruit aromas. Flavors are tart, fruit, passion fruit sourness.

5th May 2016T42 Bottleshare. Thanks to Bruce. Cloudy gold beer, untidy cream colour head. Palate is light, dry and has decent fine carbonation. Vibrant jammy peach. Little lemon acid. Peach sherbet. Acidic lemon finish. Despite the acidity, pretty drinkable.

75cl bottle shared at the Bruce tasting @42nd Level, CW. Many thanks to Bruce for this one. It pours a cloudy golden color with a small off white head. Aroma is full on passion fruit, cinnamon, vanilla. Taste is full of passion fruit apricot vanilla peaches, grapefruit white wine and funk. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, fantastic stuff

On tap at De garde release. pours out a peach skin color with a fizzy head. nose is nice passion fruit a nice apricot peach kick. Taste is more of the stone fruit passion combo along with a nice pucker sweet.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Bruce. Pours murky gold with a creamy, white head. Big passion fruit nose, lots of apricot, lemon. Light sweet flavor, strongly acidic, with more peach, passion fruit, lemon, tangerine, sweat. Light bodied with spritzy carbonation. Finishes with sturdy acidity, more strong passion fruit, peach, salty sweat. Great stuff.

Bottle big thanks to Bruce. It pours cloudy bright orange with a medium white head. The aroma is fresh, sour apricot, peach, grapefruit, orange, earthy, mango, passion fruit, pithy action and Um Bungo. The taste is crisp, sour, tart, sour mango, passion fruit, mango, bracing acidity, sherbet, earth and straw with a dry, acetic finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Nice elements, but too acidic for me.

Bottle shared by Matt - thanks! Pours initially hazy, eventually super cloudy, kind of a dirty orange brown. Small off-white head, fizzy with minimal lacing. Appearance is not the strong suit of this beer. Aroma is heavy on the passionfruit, lactic acid, lemon, peach fuzz. Flavor is medium tart, quite lactic, loads of passionfruit with a fruity peachy backdrop. Medium body. Pretty nice.

On tap at De Garde quarterly. Pours a hazy rose gold with small off white head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is strong passion fruit and funk. Thin mouth, juicy passion fruit, very acidic, some pomegranate flavor but mostly passion fruit, really enjoyed this.

Draft pour on tap at the brewery taproom t (Tillamook, OR). Pours a nice hazy craanverry pinkish hue. A decent haziness, frothy whitish head is a firmer layer. Good retention and lacing as a firmer film, thick ringer. Aromas are potent and fruity, lots of passionfruit, seedy fruity pomegranate and punchy lactic life. Lemon, citric and sour with subtle yogurt. Lovely alluring nose. Fruity and firm, lots of passionfruit and pomegraanate. Initial is fruity and sour, nice potent lactic punch. Lemon, dragonfruit and citric acidity. Fruity passion fruit, a bit of guava, pomegranate. Some rich potent sourness bites at times. Lots of fruit, passionfruit and greenness. More biting sour trail out, yogurt, pomegranate is dark but the passionfruit really sticks well. Wow, great flavor and fruit presence. Delicious stuff with a driving fruity liveliness. I really dig this. A firm fruity liveliness. Potent acidity without overwhelming. Lush deep fruit presence. Yum.

beer is a liquid. beer is beer, nothing more. but i do have a strange feeling about this one. almost a sexual energy. makes me feel frisky, like a kitten on payday. so much passion fruit. such an intense fruit beer. i couldnt stand up for almost half an hour...
One of favorite de garde beers. Tons of fruit. And it's tart to a degree but tastes like a passion fruit pomegranate fruit roll up.

At the brewery. This was one awesome beer. I also get peaches. Pours a cloudy orange color with a medium white head. A big ripe fruity nose, apple, peaches. The flavor is dark berries, sweet grape like pomegranate. peaches, fluffy palate. Just tastes wonderful.
Draft - Fresh peach. Cloudy pink gold with a decent white head. Sweet, acidic and light fruity peach. Awesome.

On tap at De Garde, pours a cloudy peachy orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out strong peaches and pomegranate - nice tartness and pithiness. Flavour is super juicy, with loads of peaches and pomegranates dominating, with some pith and an earthy dryness on the finish. So juicy and drinkable. Fantastic.
Bottle - pours peach gold white head - nose and taste of passion fruit, oak, sour lactic acid and pomegranate - medium body
